body: I had Sushi today. Hana Sushi is open again after some renovations to the shop. Nothing major; just a repaint and new floor coverings.
Went to Garden City to retrieve the parcel containing the iPhone steadycam and to buy some dinners from Coles.
Coles at Garden City didn’t have any lactose free milk so I had to go to our usual Coles to buy some there.
Went to visit mum who was admitted with double pneumonia.

We had dinner at the leagues club and then spent some time in the pokies area. I had beef stroganoff with rice and Anita had a kind of meat loaf. The meals there are very inexpensive. Both our meals were just $28 - the members price is even lower! It would have cost twice as much for a few burgers at McDonalds. At the pokies, I came out only $10 in arrears after potentially losing $100! I managed to win a small jackpot, which was a relief.
It was sunset just as we arrived at the top of Kangaroo Point Cliffs. There were a lot of people there waiting to see the sunset.
There was a multi car crash at the end of the SE Freeway, so we took a detour through the city. We were lucky as it had just happened.
Picking up granny to take her to the pokies for lunch and gambling.
We both ordered fish sliders. Erika also ordered fish but her meal was huge. I ended up eating two more whiting from her plate. Anita showed her all the Facebook pictures of Katherine at Mt Binga.
Had dinner before leaving to go to a meeting at Upper Mt Gravatt. It started to rain and the radar shows a storm coming so I will wait for it to pass.

Went to see mum again. She seems a bit worse tonight. It looks like she also has a cold. Anita had to have more X-rays so we had coffee before I went up to the ward and she came up about an hour later.

After leaving I put the bicycle in the boot of the WRX and we drive to the Glen Hotel for dinner.
We had dinner out on the verandah. It was cold but fortunately we were next to a gas heater.

The doctor showed me the recent blood test results and I still have B... Syndrome that results in an abnormal bilirubin levels. My Cholesterol is still elevated despite the changes in diet. I asked for the lesion on my face to be burnt off this time using liquid nitrogen?
Cab charge taxi to the meeting at Chermside Community Health Centre
Attended the QHSDP meeting. I had to catch a taxi there as David was going to the airport and Pat forgot about me and left before I could catch her at work.
Cab charge

Cycled home after returning to the LCCH. It was cold but I had lots of layers on this time.

Had interesting conversations with the taxi drivers. The Indian driver coming back was interested in buying a bicycle and asked about prices.

The Forester is in for a service and brakes check. I took the Sundy eBike for the short ride to the hospital. The Sundy is lighter than the Nope so is easier to get in the back of the car, but I did have to remove the basket, which meant wearing the heavy backpack on the ride.

The traffic was very heavy from Chermside Shopping onwards. We saw four ambulances go past and eventually came past the car accident on the Pine Rivers Bridge.  Two cars, four ambulance and one police car. The road was clear ahead of the accident!
It’s been several years since we have been along this road. I still remember some of the main features. It took me a while to get used to the Forester and country driving but I settled in by Kilcoy.
We went to the bakery to buy something for lunch when we get to Mt Binga.
We arrived about 20 minutes too soon, so we waited just inside the entrance to the national park.

When we arrived at the Centre the staff directed us to where we were to park. Then Katherine came over to greet us and show us around the centre and what she had been doing. You can see from the GPS data we walked all over the place!
We drove back to Blackbutt and the bakery to have coffee and I also had one of their pies. The teachers from school were also there.
Just a place to park off the street before walking up to the bakery.
Anita need to get out of the car and stretch, so we stopped to go to the Cormorant Bay Restaurant. Sadly it was closing in 15 minutes so we left straight away to look for somewhere else.
The first place at Griffith University we went to was the Environment Centre. It reminded me of the museum or a National Park Visitor Centre.
The main information tents for the open day are concentrated around the circuit. We got a bag and started collecting information sheets and booklets.
Anita and Katherine bought some lunch at the noodle bar. I bought coffees at the nearby store.
Forensic Science and Criminology
Shopping for the first time in a few weeks. We got more mini-collectables than expected and all except one was unique.
Visited mum who is going back to Arcare tomorrow morning. I hope to visit her there and bring the photo albums for the biographer
I had the beef udon tonight. I like this one so I may have it more often.
Alison called this morning and said she was still sick and wouldn’t be coming to work. With Chloe away there was just me to cover the shift. I did manage to get away early.

Came to Garden City to buy some sushi to take to mum tomorrow. Nothing will be open for tomorrow’s Ekka public holiday. I bought a beef and rice meal from the Korean stall in the Asian section, but Alison called so Katherine ate it when she came home from school. She said it was good.
Back at work after Alison phoned to say she was still too sick and was going home. I used the car this time since parking is not a problem in the late afternoon and I avoid the cold on the way home.
Ordered the Beef Udon again
I took a bento box of sushi for mum. I also brought over a collection of mums photo albums and put them in the IKEA cupboard for the biographer.
Came to see “Along with the Gods - the next 47 days” the sequel to the original Korean Epic.
We’re back at the club for dinner. This time we signed up as social members for $2.00. This saves us a few dollars on food and drinks.
Haircut using the number 3 shears. It costs around $30.00.
Anita needed Vitamin D3 because her levels were low.
We ordered 2 beef and rice meals. Katherine wanted a spicy version.

We went to the Japanese Cultural Day at the Mt Coot-tha Botanical Gardens. Most of the activities and food stalls were located in the new section. We had chicken and pork Gyoza. The stall was very popular so it took a while to get it.

There was a Japanese engraving stall, where kids could stamp symbols etc onto paper. This gave me an idea for using the laser cutter. It would be very smelly though engraving a rubber stamp template!

They were doing the tea ceremony in the Japanese Garden. I tried to use the steady cam to see how it would go. It’s a bit tricky keeping it pointed at the subject as it had a tendency to move off if the handle is moved.
We stopped at the restaurant for a coffee before leaving.
We attended a Grade 10 subject information night in the school library.

I came home early to go and see mum. She thinks she is going to die and has been writing letters to relatives asking them to come a pick up things like rugs. She has been complaining of not having any appetite.
I pushed mum around the back of Arcare in her wheelchair.
I ordered Teriyaki Chicken Fried Rice from a nearby Asian restaurant using the UberEats service. Mum ate a reasonable amount. I kept the rest in her fridge for her to have the next day.
ADO
I was getting ready to catch the bus to work when Alison called to tell me the MSLT was cancelled. I had already mentioned that if it was cancelled I would not be taking an ADO.
Refuelling the WRX
Getting the WRX washed this time.
Used the new drug scripts. Also bought a pie for lunch at the bakery
Got some more Zymil milk.

Because I was home I offered to pick up Katherine from school. One problem was getting there. It seems that everyone tries to avoid the freeway by going past the school but when combined with the school parents, the road becomes jammed. Waze had me go several kms around the back of Rochedale to get to the school in about 5 minutes less time than sitting in the traffic jam!
We all went to the club to have dinner. Anita and I had the Beef Wellington and Katherine had the roast beef. The meals were huge for the price so I’m sure it’s added weight.

Anita wanted the Forester filled up so she can get her mother and take her to the Latvian Hall. That’s a lot of driving!

I use the Caltex App to pay for the petrol. It’s a very convenient way to do it with all the details sent as a receipt by email.
I bought a new pair of pants with the zip-on leggings. The old ones were wearing through at the back.
I bought a wireless pair of Sony in-ear phones to replace the Sennheiser wired versions that were disintegrating.
We picked up a chicken udon soup to take to mum at Arcare.
Mum must have been really hungry to go through almost 3/4 of the large bowl of soup. She was much happier after we left.
One of the IR heater lamps in the bathroom blew out, so I bought two replacements from Bunnings.
ADO
As it was not raining I decided to ride over to Carindale Shopping Centre fur lunch. I ended up at the Ginga Sushi Bar where I had yakiniku special and miso soup.
I would say the current battery would last about 30 kms based on today’s ride.
Even though the traffic at the school wasn’t as bad as last Friday, I still went the back way because it’s a nice drive ‘in the country’. It added about 6 minutes to the normal trip.
Needed more milk. We seem to use way more than we ever used to?
I was at work until 6:50pm so I don’t know what happened?
Bought a steak and cheese wrap today.
It was warm enough to sit in the shade under the big trees near the playground.

Anita said they were going to Garden City for dinner so I decided to ride there after work to meet and have dinner.

The bike rack under the Cinema was back again after being removed during the construction work on the newly built BCC library.
It was easier to ride home again rather than pack the bike up in the back of the car. But it did require a lot of walking, as the car was at the other side of the shopping centre!
I walked through the lagoon section but there were already people sitting there so I continued on through to the Epicurious.
We stopped at Foodworks to buy some more Zymil milk. Unfortunately they didn’t have any!
I filled up the Forester and then went through the McDonalds Drive Through to order ice cream for us all.
